body_content.explanation: to acclimate (= change to suit different conditions of life, weather, etc.) again, especially after a period of time in a different place or situation, or to help a person or an animal do this:
examples: One soldier spoke of how he and his family would have to reacclimate to each other when he was back home.
It takes just a little bit longer for those who have been in space for six months to re-acclimate to gravity and re-adapt to being on Earth again.
The animals were reacclimatized to outdoor temperatures before release.
